catalog.name: Regional Reports
catalog.description:
The Regional Reports provide a comprehensive description of the vegetation cover condition for the most recent month on record for the Natural Resources Management regions and the Local Government Areas of Australia. 

Add either NRM or LGA to the Map and then click on the region of interest to see the report.
  Access to the old reports in https://eo-data.csiro.au .

featureInfoTemplate.template: {{NRM_REGION}} NRM, {{STATE}}. This report provides information about vegetation covering the soil surface for the {{NRM_REGION}} NRM region ({{STATE}}) during a single month with comparison to previous years. Vegetation cover indicates where soil is likely to be protected from wind and or water (hillslope) erosion. Results are shown for the whole region (polygon) and also separated by land use and tree cover. Different land uses are likely to have different cover patterns and targets. Reporting is most reliable with less than 20% tree cover. You can download the entire report as a PDF in this link. Reports for previous months for this region available in this link. A CSV file with the data used for this report available in this link. Most recent report for the entire region

{{LGA_NAME16}} LGA, {{STATE}}. This report provides information about vegetation covering the soil surface for the {{LGA_NAME16}} LGA region ({{STATE}}) during a single month with comparison to previous years. Vegetation cover indicates where soil is likely to be protected from wind and or water (hillslope) erosion. Results are shown for the whole region (polygon) and also separated by land use and tree cover. Different land uses are likely to have different cover patterns and targets. Reporting is most reliable with less than 20% tree cover. You can download the entire report as a PDF in this link. Reports for previous months for this region available in this link. A CSV file with the data used for this report available in this link. Most recent report for the entire region

catalog.name: Analysis Tools
catalog.description:
The Analysis Tools provide time-series data for selected points (pixels) or regions (polygons). 

The "Mean for point or region" function returns the mean value for the vegetation fractional cover fractions and precipitation for a given region or pixel.

The "Proportion of region within a Total Vegetation Cover range" function returns the proportion of a given region within a range of Total Vegetation Cover that you can select. 

Simply click on the function and follow the instructions.

items.name: Mean for point or region (Monthly)
items.description:
This function returns the mean value for the monthly vegetation fractional cover fractions and precipitation for a given region or pixel. Fractional cover includes green cover, non-green cover and bare ground. Total vegetation cover is green+non-green. 

You can provide the name of the polygon or pixel. You can click on a point, draw a polygon or select a polygon already displayed in the screen.

The output is a graph and the data can be downloaded as a csv file.

items.name: Mean for point or region (8-day)
items.description:
This function returns the mean value for the 8-day vegetation fractional cover fractions and precipitation for a given region or pixel. Fractional cover includes green cover, non-green cover and bare ground. Total vegetation cover is green+non-green. 

You can provide the name of the polygon or pixel. You can click on a point, draw a polygon or select a polygon already displayed in the screen.

The output is a graph and the data can be downloaded as a csv file.

items.name: Proportion of region within a Total Vegetation Cover range (Monthly)
items.description:
This function returns the proportion of a given region within a range of Total Vegetation Cover. Total cover is the sum of green and non-green cover. You can provide the name of the polygon. You must provide the lower and upper limits of total vegetation cover. You can click on a point, draw a polygon or select a polygon already diplayed in the screen.

The output is a graph and the data can be downloaded as a csv file.

items.name: Proportion of region within a Total Vegetation Cover range (8-day)
items.description:
This function returns the proportion of a given region within a range of Total Vegetation Cover. Total cover is the sum of green and non-green cover. You can provide the name of the polygon. You must provide the lower and upper limits of total vegetation cover. You can click on a point, draw a polygon or select a polygon already diplayed in the screen.

The output is a graph and the data can be downloaded as a csv file.
